## Overview

<p>
Unless specified otherwise, all assignments are due at midnight on the due date listed.
</p>
```{r}
# Read in schedule
rawdat <- read_xlsx("schedule_615.xlsx", sheet='weekly_schedule')

# Set semester start date and format weeks nicely
start.date <- as.Date("2019-08-16")
wn <- which(!is.na(rawdat$wknum)) # which rows have week numbers
wkdt <- rawdat$wknum[wn]*7 + start.date # get the week dates
weekdates <- paste0("Week ", rawdat$wknum[wn], " (", format(wkdt, "%m/%d") , ")") # format the display
#link <- paste0("wk/wk", rawdat$wknum, ".html") # create link to weekly detail webpage
#week_details <- sprintf("[%s](%s)",rawdat$Week[wn], link[wn]) # put it together

# Filter rows to display on schedule
out <- rawdat[which(rawdat$Order==1.1):nrow(rawdat), ]%>% select(Topic:Assignments)

#week <- grep("midterm|final", out$Topic, ignore.case=TRUE)

# add bullets to materials
mats <- which(!is.na(out$Materials))
out$Materials[mats] <- paste0("<ul><li>", out$Materials[mats], "</li></ul>")
out$Materials[mats] <- gsub("\r\n", "</li><li>", out$Materials[mats])

# add bold to due dates
out$Assignments <- gsub(" (", " (<b>", out$Assignments, fixed=TRUE)
out$Assignments <- gsub(" )", "</b>)", out$Assignments, fixed=TRUE)
out$Quiz <- gsub(" (", " (<b>", out$Quiz, fixed=TRUE)
out$Quiz <- gsub(" )", "</b>)", out$Quiz, fixed=TRUE)
out$`Peer Review` <- gsub(" (", " (<b>", out$pr, fixed=TRUE)
out$`Peer Review` <- gsub(" )", "</b>)", out$pr, fixed=TRUE)

out$pr <- NULL
wk.labs <-  "background-color: #7b9ab7; color: #fff;"
```

## Details

Click each link to expand or contract the details for that week. 

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# Read in schedule
raw_detail <- read_excel("schedule_615.xlsx", sheet="slo_detail")

# Function to extract week and display data
details <- function(w){
  wd <- filter(raw_detail, wk==w) %>% select(SLO, Prepare, Tuesday, Thursday)  
  # strip data columns into separate lists
  SLO  <- as.list(str_split(wd$SLO, "\r\n", simplify=TRUE))
  prep <- as.list(str_split(wd$Prepare, "\r\n", simplify=TRUE))
  tue  <- as.list(str_split(wd$Tuesday, "\r\n", simplify=TRUE))
  thu  <- as.list(str_split(wd$Thursday, "\r\n", simplify=TRUE))
  
  return(list(SLO=SLO, prep=prep, tue=tue, thu=thu))
}

```
